- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain Article XI of Chapter 26 of the Code of the City of New Orleans, concerning short-term rentals. It includes provisions for application procedures, permit types and fees, operating regulations, enforcement parameters, and penalties. The council discussed and voted on this ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 32685 - 28156 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 3 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)

- Topic: Inclusion of Short-Term Rental Platforms in Sales and Use Taxes
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend and reordain Section 150-441 of Article VI of Chapter 150 of the Code of the City of New Orleans to clarify that short-term rental platforms shall be included within the definition of "dealer" for the purposes of collecting and remitting sales and use taxes owed in connection with the short-term rental of property. The council discussed and voted on this ordinance.
- Ordinance Number: 32691 - 28157 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with 9 council members voting in favor.
- Tags/Keywords: Sales and Use Taxes, Short-Term Rental Platforms, Tax Collection

- Topic: Granting a non-exclusive wireless franchise to NEW CINGULAR WIRELESS PCS, L.L.C.
- Summary: The ordinance grants a non-exclusive wireless franchise to NEW CINGULAR WIRELESS PCS, L.L.C. to construct, maintain, and operate wireless facilities on public rights-of-way within the City of New Orleans. The locations for the facilities are subject to the approval of the City. The ordinance also provides for annual payments and the furnishing of a surety bond.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 32,564
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was amended and passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Wireless franchise, public rights-of-way, annual payments, surety bond
- UID: 7d3d28c6-dd10-486b-b62c-05b4d6a5a252

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Affordable Housing Requirements
- Summary: The ordinance outlines requirements for maintaining reserved affordable dwelling units within the same structure as market-rate units, comparable in design and not concentrated in one area. It also mandates the submission of an Affordable Housing Impact Statement (AHIS) with development bonus applications.
- Ordinance Number: 82302325-2750-43a8-9dcd-40cb034b5558
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, establishing clear guidelines for affordable housing and development bonus applications.
- Tags/Keywords: Affordable housing, development bonus, Affordable Housing Impact Statement, housing requirements
- UID: 82302325-2750-43a8-9dcd-40cb034b5558

- Topic: Building Heights and Density Bonus
- Summary: This ordinance addresses building height regulations, setbacks, and density bonus eligibility for qualifying developments. It allows for an increase in height and density for projects meeting specific criteria, including the reservation of affordable dwelling units.
- Ordinance Number: 82302325-2750-43a8-9dcd-40cb034b5558
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 4 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed, granting increased height and density for qualifying developments that reserve affordable dwelling units as per the specified criteria.
- Tags/Keywords: Building heights, density bonus, affordable dwelling units, development regulations
- UID: 82302325-2750-43a8-9dcd-40cb034b5558

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Affordable Housing Development Bonus
- Summary: The ordinance proposed text changes to the RIV Riverfront Design Overlay District to allow for a development bonus for providing affordable housing. It required at least 10% of dwelling units to be reserved as affordable for households with incomes equal to or below 80% of area median income (AMI) for a period of at least 50 years. The City Planning Commission recommended "FOR MODIFIED APPROVAL".
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with modifications as recommended by the City Planning Commission.
- Tags/Keywords: Affordable Housing, Development Bonus, RIV Riverfront Design Overlay District
- UID: 143f9fc9-198d-45c7-8fae-a2fbd3b64e97

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Development Sites and Building Heights
- Summary: Development sites with more than 100 feet of frontage along Chartres Street may increase a portion of their building height, up to a maximum of 55 feet with a maximum of four stories. Flat roofed structures should provide a parapet to mitigate the sight of rooftop equipment. Open spaces located on roofs shall be excluded from the calculation of building height and gross floor area. Eligible projects may qualify for an increase in height and/or density by incorporating affordable housing units.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 3 NAYS, 2 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance regarding building heights and density bonuses passed with majority support.
- Tags/Keywords: Development sites, building heights, density bonus, affordable housing
- UID: 1c147ed3-7eef-45d9-a611-3de4596e360d

- Topic: Appropriation of Federal Grant Funds for City Resilience Projects

- Ordinance Number: 32634, 32635
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a unanimous vote, allowing the appropriation of federal grant funds for city resilience projects.

- Topic: Appropriation of Foundation Grant Funds for Criminal Justice Initiatives
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend the operating budget of revenues for the City of New Orleans to appropriate foundation grant funds for the Office of the Mayor, Office of Criminal Justice Coordination. The funds will be used to reduce the city jail population and address racial disparities in the criminal justice system.
- Ordinance Number: 32636
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, allowing the appropriation of foundation grant funds for criminal justice initiatives.
- Tags/Keywords: Foundation grant funds, City of New Orleans, criminal justice, racial disparities
- UID: 9d89f0b6-32d8-4a03-82d5-2c112a314e16
